definition.name: Git Auto Commit
definition.description: Automatically commits files which have been changed during the workflow run and push changes back to remote repository.
definition.author: Stefan Zweifel <stefan@stefanzweifel.dev>

inputs.name: commit_message
inputs.description: Commit message

inputs.name: branch
inputs.description: Git branch name, where changes should be pushed too. Required if Action is used on the `pull_request` event

inputs.name: commit_options
inputs.description: Commit options (eg. --no-verify)

inputs.name: add_options
inputs.description: Add options (eg. -u)

inputs.name: status_options
inputs.description: Status options (eg. --untracked-files=no)

inputs.name: file_pattern
inputs.description: File pattern used for `git add`. For example `src/*.js`

inputs.name: repository
inputs.description: Local file path to the git repository. Defaults to the current directory (`.`)

inputs.name: commit_user_name
inputs.description: Name used for the commit user

inputs.name: commit_user_email
inputs.description: Email address used for the commit user

inputs.name: commit_author
inputs.description: Value used for the commit author. Defaults to the username of whoever triggered this workflow run.

inputs.name: tag_name
inputs.description: Tag name used for creating a new git tag with the commit. Keep this empty, if no tag should be created.

inputs.name: tagging_message
inputs.description: Tagging message used for creating a new git tag with the commit. Keep this empty, if no tag should be created.

inputs.name: push_options
inputs.description: Push options (eg. --force)

inputs.name: skip_dirty_check
inputs.description: Skip the check if the git repository is dirty and always try to create a commit.

inputs.name: skip_fetch
inputs.description: Skip the call to git-fetch.

inputs.name: skip_checkout
inputs.description: Skip the call to git-checkout.

inputs.name: disable_globbing
inputs.description: Stop the shell from expanding filenames (https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Filename-Expansion.html)

inputs.name: create_branch
inputs.description: Create new branch with the name of `branch`-input in local and remote repository, if it doesn't exist yet.

inputs.name: create_git_tag_only
inputs.description: Perform a clean git tag and push, without commiting anything

inputs.name: internal_git_binary
inputs.description: Internal use only! Path to git binary used to check if git is available. (Don't change this!)

outputs.name: changes_detected
outputs.description: Value is "true", if the repository was dirty and file changes have been detected. Value is "false", if no changes have been detected.

outputs.name: commit_hash
outputs.description: Full hash of the created commit. Only present if the "changes_detected" output is "true".

outputs.name: create_git_tag_only
outputs.description: Value is "true", if a git tag was created using the `create_git_tag_only`-input.
